【考法 1】 vt. 使知名： to make known openly or publicly
【例】 Their very public canoodling[kə'nuːd(ə)l] has pretty much blazoned the fact that they are having an affair.
【近】 annunciate, broadcast, declare, publicize, proclaim
【反】 withhold 保留，不透露
【考法 2】 v. 修饰，装扮： to make more attractive by adding something that is beautiful or becoming
【例】 The university's dormitory['dɔːmɪt(ə)rɪ] has been blazoned with banners. 学校宿舍被横幅所装点
【近】 adorn, bedeck, embellish, garnish
【反】 blemish, deface, mar, spoil 损害，破坏
【记】 blaze + 音：章 火状的章
Anger is a short madness. 发火是短暂的疯狂。
